result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone F. Donald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment & mental heatlth. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
++   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
++   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with minors, victims or their residence unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Comply with Sex Offender Registry and their rules.  Seek permission from probation agent to engage in any romantic relationships.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions and is CONSECUTIVE to 14CF1076.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court costs ordered and to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.
from DE             cc: DA & Atty for DE
Reply/Answer to Defendant's Discovery Demand/State's Reciprocal Demand ADA T Binger.

Defendant Tyrone F. Donald appeared with Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
